1.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honour is not comely for a fool.

2.text: As a bird by wandering, as a swallow by flying, So reviling without cause doth not come.

3.text: A whip is for a horse, a bridle for an ass, And a rod for the back of fools.

4.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou be like to him—even thou.

5.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own eyes.

6.text: He is cutting off feet, he is drinking injury, Who is sending things by the hand of a fool.

7.text: Weak have been the two legs of the lame, And a parable in the mouth of fools.

8.text: As one who is binding a stone in a sling, So is he who is giving honour to a fool.

9.text: A thorn hath gone up into the hand of a drunkard, And a parable in the mouth of fools.

10.text: Great is the Former of all, And He is rewarding a fool, And is rewarding transgressors.

11.text: As a dog hath returned to its vomit, A fool is repeating his folly.

12.text: Thou hast seen a man wise in his own eyes, More hope of a fool than of him!

13.text: The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is in the way, A lion is in the broad places.’

14.text: The door turneth round on its hinge, And the slothful on his bed.

15.text: The slothful hath hid his hand in a dish, He is weary of bringing it back to his mouth.

16.text: Wiser is the slothful in his own eyes, Than seven men returning a reason.

17.text: Laying hold on the ears of a dog, Is a passer-by making himself wrath for strife not his own.

18.text: As one pretending to be feeble, Who is casting sparks, arrows, and death,

19.text: So hath a man deceived his neighbour, And hath said, ‘Am not I playing?’

20.text: Without wood is fire going out, And without a tale-bearer, contention ceaseth,

21.text: Coal to burning coals, and wood to fire, And a man of contentions to kindle strife.

22.text: The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.

23.text: Silver of dross spread over potsherd, Are burning lips and an evil heart.

24.text: By his lips doth a hater dissemble, And in his heart he placeth deceit,

25.text: When his voice is gracious trust not in him, For seven abominations are in his heart.

26.text: Hatred is covered by deceit, Revealed is its wickedness in an assembly.

27.text: Whoso is digging a pit falleth into it, And the roller of a stone, to him it turneth.

28.text: A lying tongue hateth its bruised ones, And a flattering mouth worketh an overthrow!
